TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi abstract sealed beforefieldinit MessageFactory extends System.Object

Docs.summary: Contains utility methods for various message types a bot can return.
Docs.remarks:
The following apply to message actions in general.
See the channel's documentation for limits imposed upon the contents of the text of the message to send.
To control various characteristics of your bot's speech such as voice, rate, volume, pronunciation, and pitch, specify text to speak in Speech Synthesis Markup Language (SSML) format.
Channels decide how each card action manifests in their user experience. In most cases, the cards are clickable. In others, they may be selected by speech input. In cases where the channel does not offer an interactive activation experience (e.g., when interacting over SMS), the channel may not support activation whatsoever. The decision about how to render actions is controlled by normative requirements elsewhere in this document (e.g. within the card format, or within the suggested actions definition).

MemberSignature.Value: public static Microsoft.Bot.Schema.IMessageActivity Attachment (Microsoft.Bot.Schema.Attachment attachment, string text = null, string ssml = null, string inputHint = null);
.method public static hidebysig class Microsoft.Bot.Schema.IMessageActivity Attachment(class Microsoft.Bot.Schema.Attachment attachment, string text, string ssml, string inputHint) cil managed
static member Attachment : Microsoft.Bot.Schema.Attachment * string * string * string -> Microsoft.Bot.Schema.IMessageActivity

Docs.param: Attachment to include in the message.
Optional, the text of the message to send.
Optional, text to be spoken by your bot on a speech-enabled channel.

Optional, indicates whether your bot is accepting, expecting, or ignoring user input after the message is delivered to the client. One of: "acceptingInput", "ignoringInput", or "expectingInput". Default is "acceptingInput".
Docs.summary: Returns a message activity that contains an attachment.
Docs.returns: A message activity containing the attachment.

Docs.param: The URL of the image or video to send.
The MIME type of the image or video.
Optional, the name of the image or video file.
Optional, the text of the message to send.
Optional, text to be spoken by your bot on a speech-enabled channel.

Optional, indicates whether your bot is accepting, expecting, or ignoring user input after the message is delivered to the client. One of: "acceptingInput", "ignoringInput", or "expectingInput". Default is null.
Docs.summary: Returns a message activity that contains a single image or video.
Docs.returns: A message activity containing the attachment.
Docs.exception: or is null, empty, or white space.
